Selected Answer: D
Not correct, this same question appears in the self-assessment questions of the 7th CRISC manual (chapter 2): Controls are deployed to achieve desired control objectives based on risk assessments and business requirements. The gap between the desired control objectives and the effectiveness of the control design identifies deficiencies.
Control deficiency can be identified through Gap Analysis only

Answer is Gap Analysis - A gap analysis would be the BEST method to assist in identifying control deficiencies in this situation. A gap analysis involves comparing the current state of the organization's controls with a desired state or industry best practices, and identifying any gaps or deficiencies in the controls. This information can be used to identify areas for improvement and to develop a plan to address any control deficiencies.
Countermeasure analysis means root cause analysis.
